intro: Tephroseris crispa, commonly known as the curly tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tephroseris crispa is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments.
